Get started

Source: vignettes/getting-started.Rmd
getting-started.Rmd

The exoplanets package lets users access NASA’s Exoplanet Archive database in two ways:

  1. By providing a table name using exo()
  2. By providing a query URL using exo_raw()

Where exo() simply requires the name of a table and exo_raw() requires the full, raw URL. For example, the following lines are equivalent:

library(exoplanets)

exoplanets1 <- exo("exoplanets")
exoplanets2 <- exo_raw("https://exoplanetarchive.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/nstedAPI/nph-nstedAPI?table=exoplanets")

all.equal(exoplanets1, exoplanets2)
#> [1] TRUE

To see a list of all available tables see the documentation here. Additionally, a list exo_tables is available:

names(exo_tables)
#>  [1] "exoplanets"               "compositepars"           
#>  [3] "exomultpars"              "aliastable"              
#>  [5] "microlensing"             "cumulative"              
#>  [7] "q1_q17_dr25_sup_koi"      "q1_q17_dr25_koi"         
#>  [9] "q1_q17_dr24_koi"          "q1_q16_koi"              
#> [11] "q1_q12_koi"               "q1_q8_koi"               
#> [13] "q1_q6_koi"                "q1_q17_dr25_tce"         
#> [15] "q1_q17_dr24_tce"          "q1_q16_tce"              
#> [17] "q1_q12_tce"               "keplerstellar"           
#> [19] "q1_q17_dr25_supp_stellar" "q1_q17_dr25_stellar"     
#> [21] "q1_q17_dr24_stellar"      "q1_q16_stellar"          
#> [23] "q1_q12_stellar"           "keplertimeseries"        
#> [25] "keplernames"              "kelttimeseries"          
#> [27] "superwasptimeseries"      "k2targets"               
#> [29] "k2candidates"             "k2names"                 
#> [31] "missionstars"             "mission_exocat"

If using RStudio, this list allows convenient autocompletion in case you forget the table names:

k2names <- exo(exo_tables$k2names)
str(k2names)
#> 'data.frame':    422 obs. of  9 variables:
#>  $ epic_host      : chr  "EPIC 60017806" "EPIC 60021410" "EPIC 201367065" "EPIC 201367065" ...
#>  $ k2_campaign_str: chr  "E" "E" "1" "1" ...
#>  $ k2_name        : chr  "K2-1 b" "K2-2 b" "K2-3 b" "K2-3 c" ...
#>  $ alt_name       : chr  "WASP-28 b" "HIP 116454 b" "K2-3 b" "K2-3 c" ...
#>  $ tm_designation : chr  "2MASS J23342787-0134482" "2MASS J23354927+0026436" "2MASS J11292037-0127173" "2MASS J11292037-0127173" ...
#>  $ k2_kepmag      : num  11.5 9.51 11.57 11.57 11.57 ...
#>  $ ra_str         : chr  "23h34m27.88s" "23h35m49.28s" "11h29m20.39s" "11h29m20.39s" ...
#>  $ dec_str        : chr  "-01d34m48.2s" "+00d26m43.9s" "-01d27m17.2s" "-01d27m17.2s" ...
#>  $ last_update    : chr  "2015-07-30" "2015-07-30" "2015-07-30" "2015-07-30" ...

Finally, there are 3 tables which require an additional parameter in order to access them, these are all time series datasets:

names(exo_tables)[which(grepl("timeseries", names(exo_tables)))]
#> [1] "keplertimeseries"    "kelttimeseries"      "superwasptimeseries"

For example, the kelttimeseries table requires either the quarter or a Kepler ID, exo("kelttimeseries&quarter=14"). Note, these datasets are quite large and can take awhile. All of these additional parameter requirements are documented in the documentation.

Developed by Tyler Littlefield.
